Buyer’s Remorse Pt.1

Buyer’s Remorse Pt.1

by John on November 24, 2012 at 3:36 PM
Posted In: Comic

What’s this? No Franky, Elsa, or Eartha…? Who are these strange creatures? WHAT are they?

Remember seeing them before? Yes, they are the ones who Eartha covertly communicates with. They’re mummies! Possibly undead- and even worse- REPUBLICAN! What is there connection to Mitt Romney, Karl Rove… or more importantly, to Franky?

More long-brewing secrets will be revealed next time!

Election Elation!

by John on November 7, 2012 at 1:08 AM
Posted In: Blog

It’s 1 A.M. and Romney just conceded. Not gonna gloat, but if he won, it would have been MONSTROUS. But he conceded good.

So happy Obama won. And so are Elsa and Franky. Thank you, stupid humons!

A Dedication to MONSTERS!

by John on November 4, 2012 at 4:40 PM
Posted In: Blog

My pal Aidan Casserly (a.k.a. “DadaHyena”) dedicated a recent page of his awesomely villainous webcomic Scapula to me and Franky! How awesome is that? And even better, he used one of my favorite characters, Knuckle Sam! I hope she and/or her girlcrush (and mine) Jemini can guest star over here one day, as Scap himself did once or twice. This here is my “thank you” drawing in reply, but go check out the comic- it’s MONSTROUSLY fun!!!


4 Comments

Dr. Frankenstein- Tarot Card Magician!

by John on November 3, 2012 at 12:16 AM
Posted In: Blog

This is one of my two entries into the Webcomics Tarot Project, which their site describes thus:
“…a community project in which online comic authors and artists of many varieties, genres, and styles contribute to a collective tarot deck!”
As soon as I saw The Magician, I thought he had to be portrayed by my version of Victor Frankenstein. I’ve been sketching him for years, long before I dreamed up Frankenstein Superstar. I haven’t had a chance to show him in the comic yet, so this is his debut.
The site says they might print the deck if there’s enough interest. If you like what you see, please email Miluette and DEMAND* a printed deck!

*and by “demand” I mean ask very nicely


└ Tags: tarot, webcomic

FRANKENSTORM is coming!

by John on October 29, 2012 at 11:18 AM
Posted In: Blog

As u can see, Frankenstein LOVE storms- but hate people! So if you’re in an area where evacuation is recommended- GET OUT!

We’re in breezy Washington Heights- pretty much the highest point in Manhattan. So, safe from flooding. Winds? We’ll see.

Some people are debating the relevance of the name “Frankenstorm”, but I think it’s totally makes sense. Not only is it two or more things thrown together to form something monstrous, there’s also a possibility that man-made global climate change is lending power to the storm.

Be safe everyone. And I hope the power stays on- new comic coming!


└ Tags: frankenstorm, gameofthrones
  Comment

Eartha does Michonne!

by John on October 19, 2012 at 6:22 PM
Posted In: Blog

Really looking forward to The Walking Dead this weekend. Last week’s season premiere was really great. Time has passed, the gang have become way more comfortable with killing zombies- but maybe losing touch with their humanity? Rick sure seems to be. Can he be a good leader, and still be a good man/father/husband? Should he really be letting that awful child wave that gun around? And what’s wrong with a little dog food now and then?

If there’s one thing that’s scarier than flesh-eating zombies, it’s extra-rotten zombies in riot gear. Awesome. Feels like it’s going to be a great season. And Eartha is looking forward to more hot Michonne action.
